com.konakart.app

Class CustomerTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.konakart.app.CustomerTag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomerTagIf

    public class CustomerTag
extends java.lang.Object
implements CustomerTagIf
    A customer tag is used to save customer related information used mainly for marketing purposes.

      • MULTI_INT_TYPE

        public static final int MULTI_INT_TYPE
        The string in the Value attribute consists of multiple integers separated by a delimiter. The maxInts attributes determines how many integers are allowed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        The string in the Value attribute is a Decimal

        public static final int BOOLEAN_TYPE
        The string in the Value attribute is a boolean (should contain the string true or false)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AGE_TYPE

        public static final int AGE_TYPE
        The string in the Value attribute is a Date. When creating expressions you can define the value to be greater or less than a length of time (in seconds) rather than comparing it to a specific date.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MULTI_INT_PLUS_TIME_TYPE

        public static final int MULTI_INT_PLUS_TIME_TYPE
        The string in the Value attribute consists of multiple integer plus timestamp pairs separated by a delimiter. The maxInts attributes determines how many integer/timestamp pairs are allowed. The integer and timestamp are separated by a space character. The timestamp is the number of milliseconds since 1st January 1970 (Epoch time).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getValueAsInt

        public int getValueAsInt()
                  throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Utility method to return an int. An exception is thrown if the value is null or can't be parsed as an int.
        Returns:
        Returns an int
        Throws:
        KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • getValueAsIntArray

        public int[] getValueAsIntArray()
        Utility method to return an array of integers. An array of integers is stored in a String format with each integer separated by a delimiter. This method parses the String and returns an array of integers. It works for both MULTI_INT_TYPE or MULTI_INT_PLUS_TIME_TYPE tag types.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of integers.

      • getValueAsIntAndTimeArray

        public IntAndTimePair[] getValueAsIntAndTimeArray()
                                           throws com.konakart.app.KKException
        Utility method to return an array of integer and timestamp pairs. An array of integer and timestamp pairs is stored in a String format with each integer and timestamp pair separated by a delimiter. This method parses the String and returns an array of integer and timestamp pairs.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of integer and timestamp pairs.
        Throws:
        KKException - if the conversion fails - usually due to an unexpected format

      • getValueAsDate

        public java.util.Date getValueAsDate()
                              throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                                     java.text.ParseException
        Utility method to return a Date. Null is returned if the value is null. An exception is thrown if the value isn't null but can't be parsed as a Date.

        Throws:
        KKException - an unexpected KKException exception

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Description copied from interface: CustomerTagIf
        The type of tag. Valid values are:
        • STRING_TYPE=0: The tag value is a String
        • INT_TYPE=1: The tag value is an integer
        • MULTI_INT_TYPE=2: The tag value contains one or more integers separated by a delimiter. The maxInts attributes determines how many integers are allowed.
        • DECIMAL_TYPE=3: The tag value is a decimal.
        • DATE_TYPE=4: The tag value is a date.
        • BOOLEAN_TYPE=5: The tag value is a boolean and so must contain the string true or false
        • AGE_TYPE=6: The tag value is a date. When creating expressions you can define the value to be greater or less than a length of time (in seconds) rather than comparing it to a specific date.
        • MULTI_INT_PLUS_TIME_TYPE=7: The tag value contains one or more integer and timestamp pairs separated by a delimiter. The maxInts attributes determines how many integers are allowed. The integer and timestamp are separated by a space character. The timestamp is the number of milliseconds since 1st January 1970 (Epoch time)
        Specified by:
        getType in interface CustomerTagIf
        Returns:
        the type

      • setType

        public void setType(int type)
        Description copied from interface: CustomerTagIf
        The type of tag. Valid values are:
        • STRING_TYPE=0: The tag value is a String
        • INT_TYPE=1: The tag value is an integer
        • MULTI_INT_TYPE=2: The tag value contains one or more integers separated by a delimiter. The maxInts attributes determines how many integers are allowed.
        • DECIMAL_TYPE=3: The tag value is a decimal.
        • DATE_TYPE=4: The tag value is a date.
        • BOOLEAN_TYPE=5: The tag value is a boolean and so must contain the string true or false
        • AGE_TYPE=6: The tag value is a date. When creating expressions you can define the value to be greater or less than a length of time (in seconds) rather than comparing it to a specific date.
        • MULTI_INT_PLUS_TIME_TYPE=7: The tag value contains one or more integer and timestamp pairs separated by a delimiter. The maxInts attributes determines how many integers are allowed. The integer and timestamp are separated by a space character. The timestamp is the number of milliseconds since 1st January 1970 (Epoch time)
        Specified by:
        setType in interface CustomerTagIf
        Parameters:
        type - the type to set
